line: We'll combine the zipperoo with the terror drop, and move clown town after the Ferris wheel, and we end the whole ride with a house of mirrors bouncy castle. It's great! A citywide amusement park on a single track. And you only have to wait in line once!
Delivery!
Hi Paul!
Hey boys, you ordered 20 tons of building material?
We sure did!
Okay, sign here. Hmm, thought i had a pen here somewhere...
No problem, I'll just use the pen you left here yesterday. (signs form) Ferb and I modified it so you won't lose it again.
Huh. What did you guys do, install a homing sensor?
Actually, we just put a clip on it.
Cool! Haha, here's your form.
Hi, dad. Yes, I just delivered to Phineas and Ferb. Yes. Yes, they are. No, I left them the blue copy.
No, son. You always have to leave them the pink copy. The blue copy's yours. You gotta take your job more seriously. Now you're running seven seconds behind!
Dad, I'm not sure if I really wanna be a delivery guy.
Of course you wanna be a delivery guy. You just don't wanna be a delivery guy who's seven seconds behind. Step it up!
Alright, Dad. Talk to you later, bye. (hangs up phone; turns on radio)
Hey hey, listeners, the WJOP's party van is out there somewhere in the Tri-State Area. The first lucky listener who spot the party van and say the Phrase that Pays, wins a special prize!
(radio off) Ooh, here's my next delivery.
What a weird looking building. (goes into Evil Incorporated to find that the elevator has broken down) Out of order? Great! (struggles up the many flights of stairs) (knocks)
(from inside) It's open~.
(goes in with the package) Helloo. Delivery. (a cage falls from above, trapping him in a platypus-sized cage)
Hey, you're not Perry the Platyp- Oh, sorry about that. (retracts the trap) I was expecting someone else.
No problem. Happens to me all the time.
Really? (signs the form)
I'm just kidding.
Aaa-ah. Hey nice clip.
Thanks. Hey, I like your place. What do you do here?
Well, you know, different things, but today I'm building a Juice-inator (shows Paul the Inator) It's going to turn City Hall into juice!
Oho, is it now?
Yeah, then I'm gonna take over the Tri-State Area! You know, like you too.
Well, at least you got a plan. I haven't figured out what I'm wanna do with my life.
Don't sell yourself short, perhaps you can be one of my minions! Not an indoor minion, but a minion that keep the coalfires burning.
Yeah, I'm not sure that's a step up. Here you go (hands blue copy then leaves)
You should think about that offer! Miniony! It's a growth industry. (looks at the blue copy in his hand) Oh, he forgot to leave me the pink copy.
(as he gets inside his truck) Juice City Hall, what a character.
Hi Paul. (Paul waves at him)
That's what they did with the building material!
We're still looking for that first listener to spot WJOP's party van, and say the Phrase that Pays--
(getting off his truck to see the van) Hey, you're the WJOP party van!
Hey, you're the first listener to spot us!
Wow! If only I knew the phrase that pays.
(taps his bell) That's it baby. The phrase that pays is The Phrase That Pays! You win the grand prize!
I won? I won! (fanfare) What did I win?!
The band Love Händel will play at your job! (van opens to show the band inside)
That's impossible! I work..on a truck..
♪ He keeps two hands firmly on the wheel ♪
(answering to the headset over the band noise) Uh, hello?
I got a complaint from the City Hall, they haven't got their package yet.
♪ He's driving safe (He's a safe driver) ♪
Sorry Dad. I had a delay, but, but I'm on my way.
♪ He's on his way, Yeah, yeah, he's on his way ♪
♪ There's a dweeb in the crosswalk ♪
For your information, it's not sci-fi, it's speculative fiction.
♪ Speculative fiction is such an addiction! Speculative fiction! ♪
♪ We're going to the City Hall next to the Danville Mall! ♪
Finally you're here with my box.
You know, Mayor Doofenshmirtz, I just delivered  a package to a Heinz Doofenshmirtz.
(signs the form) Yes that's my older brother. Charming...man.
That box is really light.
That's because it's empty. I just needed a box. My cat loves to play with them.
♪ Kitty in a box, kitty in a box ♪
Are they with you?
(sighs) Yes. Yes they are.
Well guys, like I was sayin', I'm not sure that I'm totally fulfilled as a delivery guy.
♪ He's not sure that he's totally fulfilled as a delivery guy (He's not sure) ♪
There's a whole world of things to do out there.
♪ There's a whole world of things to do out there! ♪
I mean, look at..look at those kids.
♪ Look at those kids- ♪
Hey, we know them. Hey Phineas! Hey Ferb! (all three waves at the kids)
Hey guys!
(to the band) And you guys. What is it you really want?
♪ We're hungry and we wanna eat! ♪
Fine. (drives the truck to the nearest food stand)
So at this point I can grab Mom in her hair appointment and bring her over where I think the boys are heading. And calculating we'll go by that weird looking building downtown, at exactly 4.59 pm.
Candace, I'd really like to help you with your latest busting endeavor, but I have customers waiting. (points to the band singing in line)
♪ We're hungry and we wanna eat! ♪
(answers his phone) Hey Dad, I'm just stoppin' for lunch (listens, then closes phone) He said we have another delivery for Heinz Doofenshmirtz. We gotta go back to headquarters and pick it up.
♪ We'll take that to go, with extra dipping sauce ♪ (Swampy: Honey barbeque!)
(coming out of elevator, then sees Paul on the floor) You know, they fixed the elevator.
Delivery! Again.
Oh goody, it's arrived. One last part for my Juice-inator.
Oh right, you're still on that juice thing.

Yeah, my Juice-inator, my giant menacing machine that will turn City Hall into juice, completely discrediting and embarrassing my brother the Mayor at his 5pm media event. Step One, in my evil scheme to take over The TRI-STATE AREA!!
Wow. You've a rich fancy life, doncha?
(offscreen) I've been told so. Do you have a pen?
(offscreen) Yes, I do.
(offscreen) Oh, I remember this baby. Y'know, if I had a clip like that on my pen, I'd never lose it.
I think your little, uh...What is that, a dachshund?
Platypus.
(offscreen) Looks like he doesn't wanna be in that cage.
Oh, him? No, no, he likes it. (giving back the clipboard) Here ya go. (takes the package) I'll take that. Thanks for everything. See ya.
Hmm...
Why don't you use the elevator? (walks in and pushes down) Got a song for that?
Actually, we do!
♪ We just climbed up sixty-five flights! ♪
(offscreen) The last delivery of the day. (cut to Paul and Love Händel walking up to the door) OWCA, the Organization Without a Cool Acronym. Boy, they aren't kidding.
♪ Sliding down a tube, yeah ♪
Great googly moogly! A distress signal! Agent P is really trapped! Why won't he use the bevy of tools and weapons conveniently located in his hat?
Delivery!
(squeaky) Um, I'm gonna sign for the package.
Carl, your voice just got squeaky! I know that squeaking!
(to Paul) Uh, where do I sign?
Carl, what are you not telling me?
Sir, Agent P doesn't have his hat tools. I took them out to clean and repair them.
Something inside me just broke.
(reaching offscreen) I have the tools right here.
Well, what good are they to him here? Poor Agent P, he's just a platypus trapped in a cage. Wearing a tiny hat, a little fedora...
♪ A platypus in a fedora... ♪
...trapped by an evil scientist...
♪ In a weird looking building... ♪
...intent on juicing City Hall.
(to Paul) ♪ Hey, you know that guy! ♪
Hey, I know that guy! I've seen your friend!
♪ It took you long enough! ♪
All of our other agents are busy out in the field. If-If only there was a way to get these tools to Agent P.
Yeah, before Doofenshmirtz juices City Hall in seven minutes!
♪ Seven minutes! ♪

Hightail just happens to have a seven-minute delivery! I can get those tools to your friend! I've never used it, but here's the 237 form. Sign at the bottom here, here's a pen, initial this on page two.
♪ Sign on the bottom! ♪
Put those tools in here! I've got the regulation box!
♪ It's a regulation box! ♪
Aaaand you keep the pink copy. The blue copy's mine!
Good luck, young man! (they leave) We could use someone like him at the Agency. Carl, why don't we have a soundtrack band?
♪ Here's our card! ♪
Schedule's gotta wait, Dad! I have a special delivery to make!
♪ Paul's on his way to deliver some tools ♪
Rush hour! Tape yourselves together, boys! I've got an idea!
Hey, Paul!
Hey, kids! Just hitchin' a ride! (Once they approach D.E.I., he cuts the tape apart.) Right, here's good. Thanks, guys!
(offscreen) See ya, Paul!
Here ya go, dude! Sign here.

And... (The clipboard latches onto the lever.) Hey! (Perry punches Doof.) Perry the Platypus?! Take that! (Doof pulls a lever and Perry falls through a trap door.) You won't get out of there in time to stop me! (He pulls the lever on the inator. Cut to a wide shot to reveal Paul taping the inator shut.) What? What are you doing up there?
Just wrapping up a few loose ends!
Wow! Metaphorical and literal!
Little dude, we should get outta here.
Curse you, Perry the Platypus and Paul the Delivery Guy!
Paul the Mobile Logistics Technician!
Well, excuuuuuuuse me!
(tasting the juice) Mmm...tastes like pineapple. (Love Händel swims by him.) Hey, Love Händel!
Hey, guys, we're covered in juice and packing tape! What does that remind you of?
Detroit, 1984! (High fives Danny) Whoo!
I can't believe you made me leave my hair appointment for this!
But...but...it's juice! (to Phineas) What do you know about this?
Excellent work, young man! Excellent! Y'know, it's unprecedented, uh, you being a human, but I'd like to offer you a job at the Agency. What do you say, son? Ya wanna fight evil?
Thanks, but no thanks. I've found how I can contribute to the world. By being a mobile logistics technician!
That's a delivery guy, sir.
I know what it is! (Perry reaches down and picks up Paul's pen.) Huh, nice pen.
